alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 9:20PM EST until December 25 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. .Snowmelt and rain from yesterday`s storm has resulted in gradual rises on the Barton River. Minor flooding is occurring. For the Lake Memphremagog...including Coventry...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Barton River Near Coventry. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will flood. There will be extensive field and lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain steady near 8.3 feet through early Sunday morning, then start to slowly recede. It is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 7.6 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
